headline.main: ISLAND ABANDONED; Communique Says Fight for Crete Was Most Furious of War NAZIS ALSO LOST HEAVILY Bombing Operations Continue -- Berlin States That 10,000 Prisoners Have Been Taken BRITISH EVACUATE 15,000 FROM CRETE

lead_paragraph: LONDON, June 1 -- Heavy and sad, though not unexpected, was the news that the War Office announced of Crete tonight. It said that 15,000 British troops had been withdrawn after twelve days of the most furious fighting of this war. "It must be admitted that our losses have been severe," the War Office said.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
